essay.question-text: Using points and examples from the talk, discuss the various types of forest fires.
essay.sample-answer-text:
SAMPLE ANSWER
In this talk, the professor discusses three different kinds of forest fires: surface fires, crown fires, and ground fires.
Surface fires burn on forest surfaces. They move slowly and remain low to the ground.
Crown fires burn in the tops of trees. They move quickly from treetop to treetop and can cause a lot of property damage.
Ground fires burn below the forest floor and are usually caused by lightning. They are slow-moving and last for a long time, and because they are underground they can be difficult to detect.
